abstract: The scroll view’s vertical scrolling elasticity mode.
overview:
## Discussion

A scroll view can scroll its contents past its bounds to achieve an elastic effect.

When set to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView/Elasticity/automatic], scrolling the vertical axis beyond its document bounds only occurs if any of the following are true: the vertical scroller is visible, the content height is greater than view height, or the horizontal scroller hidden. The default value is [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView/Elasticity/automatic].

See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView/Elasticity] for possible values.

# verticalScrollElasticity

**Instance Property**

The scroll view’s vertical scrolling elasticity mode.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var verticalScrollElasticity: NSScrollView.Elasticity { get set }
```

## Discussion

A scroll view can scroll its contents past its bounds to achieve an elastic effect.

When set to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView/Elasticity/automatic], scrolling the vertical axis beyond its document bounds only occurs if any of the following are true: the vertical scroller is visible, the content height is greater than view height, or the horizontal scroller hidden. The default value is [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView/Elasticity/automatic].

See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSScrollView/Elasticity] for possible values.

## Specifying the Scroll View Elasticity

- **horizontalScrollElasticity**: The scroll view’s horizontal scrolling elasticity mode.

items.description: The scroll view’s horizontal scrolling elasticity mode.
